Text.Value: RAPHAEL IS STRIDING ACROSS THE PLANES CHASING THE BEAT OF YOUR TERRIFIED HEART

EditorData.NodeContext: dramatic, enjoying the intensity of the situation despite its dangers

Text.Value: I have no idea where it is.
I must have misplaced it.
AND YOU WON'T BE ABLE TO SAVE ME WHILE YOU'RE BEING DIGESTED
Presumably, you intend to chew through the chains, cracking your teeth like eggshells.

EditorData.NodeContext: not sarcastic - she genuinely believes this is what the player plans to do, ludicrous as it is

Text.Value: I will bring the Hammer. And we will be ready for Raphael.
I'll make sure I'm ready.
But if you must, make sure I'm with you. He makes mistakes when he's angry, and seeing me running free will make him as angry as an axe-head.
This all sounds like more trouble than it's worth.
How disappointing.

EditorData.NodeContext: flat, not enough energy to be emotional

Text.Value: THEN RUN RUN RUN AS FAST AS YOU CAN
Retrace your steps all the way back to the cradle and your mother's womb if you have to. FIND THE HAMMER.

EditorData.NodeContext: composing herself to try and give clear instructions that become increasingly deranged

Text.Value: Let's do this.
And you have precisely zero ways of breaking me out of my chains.
LIKE I HAVE A CHOICE
I don't think the Hammer is even on this plane of existence. That is quite a quandary.

EditorData.NodeContext: composing herself as she sounds out the sheer impossibility of the situation

Text.Value: I'm getting out of here without you.
It won't work! The Hammer is the only thing capable of shattering the chains.

EditorData.NodeContext: first phrase is urgent, then she calms a little to deliver the info

Text.Value: NOT HERE YOU WON'T YOU BLUNDERING CRICKET
I'll go find it.
BUT DO YOU EXPECT TO SHATTER THE CHAINS WITH YOUR THICK SKULL?
DON'T
Maybe that's why nobody has. I hoped you were different.
He still has your contract. And while he does, you have approximately zero ways of surviving an encounter with him.

EditorData.NodeContext: composing herself and trying to make this sound less dire than it is

Text.Value: If he still has your contract when that happens, you're dead as dung.
DID YOU EXPECT TO BREAK THEM WITH YOUR THICK SKULL?

EditorData.NodeContext: panicked outburst, incredulous at player's stupidity

Text.Value: I was rather hoping I'd be leaving with you rather than sizzling like a frog in a furnace.
Careful. The jailor will swallow you whole if you take another step.
Leave.
The sound of the chains breaking will echo across the planes - Raphael will fly home furious when he hears it.

EditorData.NodeContext: mostly calm, but with a hint of dread. She's very scared of Raphael

Text.Value: Sorry, sorry, sorry. I'm sure your skull is lovely. I can't wait to see it. WITH ALL THE SKIN ATTACHED OF COURSE.

EditorData.NodeContext: composing herself after an outburst and trying to placate the player. On final phrase she's afraid she's accidentally threatened them and is clarifying manically.

Text.Value: You found my prison. My body is held in chains just beyond.

EditorData.NodeContext: composing herself after outburst on previous node, calmly explaining the situation

Text.Value: I TOLD YOU HOW IMPORTANT IT IS AT LEAST A MILLION TIMES
I'll still be here, hoping you change your mind.
No, no, no, don't listen to me. You're going to do just fine. I'll be waiting.

EditorData.NodeContext: composing herself and trying to be reassuring while clearly panicking

Text.Value: But you didn't bring the Hammer. It's the only thing that can break my chains.
It's still in the Archive.
IT'S TIME TO FLY THIS COOP ON A HOPE AND A PRAYER
You'll have to find it, lickety-split, right after you free me.
Freeing you is more trouble than it's worth.
BUT WHERE IS YOUR CONTRACT YOU INGLORIOUS LUMP

EditorData.NodeContext: outburst, insulting the player but only because she's frustrated

Text.Value: The whole House is tumbling down, and Raphael's striding across the planes to come catch a mouse.

EditorData.NodeContext: in awe of the incredibly dangerous situation she and the player are in

Text.Value: I hope you manage to escape regardless. Goodbye, goodbye, goodbye, goodbye.

EditorData.NodeContext: encouraging but sad, expecting this to be her final goodbye

Text.Value: BUT YOUR MEAT IS COOKED YOUR SOUL IS SCORCHED AND YOUR RACE IS RUN

EditorData.NodeContext: happy outburst, enjoying the patterns of the language despite the dire news they contain

Text.Value: Ahem. It's in the Archive.

EditorData.NodeContext: composing herself after an outburst and delivering a clear instruction, calmly

Text.Value: HA HA HA HA HA
YOU SOUND SO BRAVE BUT WE REALLY DON'T HAVE A CHOICE
You had it when you arrived, so go and find it.

EditorData.NodeContext: composing herself to try and give clear instructions

Text.Value: It's still in the Archive.
When you remove it, the whole House will go up in flames.
Leave.
Why can't I just free you now?
MY HEART IS SINKING LIKE A STORM-TOSSED SHIP
I'll go find it.
BUTTERFINGERS
You really went and did it, didn't you?

EditorData.logicalname: SAW HOPE IN PRISON, STOLE TREASURE

Text.Value: And Raphael will fly home furious.

EditorData.NodeContext: mostly calm, but with a hint of dread. She's very scared of Raphael

Text.Value: READY FOR RAPHAEL'S HOMECOMING? HA! HE'LL USE YOU AS A HANDKERCHIEF

EditorData.NodeContext: Quzizical and incredulous on first phrase (you can't possibly be ready for this, are you mad?). Forced, single 'ha'. Then the last phrase is a terrifying prospect

Text.Value: Now swing that big, beautiful Hammer, crack open my chains, and let's get out of here.
Yes it is. And when you remove it, the whole House will go up in flames.
Any advice when it comes to fighting Raphael?

Synopsis: Hope will stop players to warn them about the prison ahead, and that they need to have Orphic Hammer to help her
